FuncDef: The display time-delay-detect status command displays the transmission delay on each MP-group member link.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Examples: Serial1/0/1/1:1 Max time delay in history:1000000000
Serial1/0/0/3:1 Max time delay in history:1000000000
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After transmission delay detection is enabled on MP-group member links, the device sends a detection packet every second to detect the transmission delay on each member link. To view the transmission delay on each member link, run the display time-delay-detect status interface mp-group mp-group-number command.
Prerequisites
An MP group has been created, and interfaces have been added to the MP group.
Configuration Impact
After transmission delay detection is enabled on MP-group member links, if the transmission delay on a member link reaches the configured threshold, the link stops transmitting service data. Therefore, you are advised to reserve backup member interfaces to ensure sufficient transmission bandwidth.
